skill.name: doc-coauthoring
skill.description: Guide users through a structured workflow for co-authoring documentation. Use when user wants to write documentation, proposals, technical specs, decision docs, or similar structured content. This workflow helps users efficiently transfer context, refine content through iteration, and verify the doc works for readers. Trigger when user mentions writing docs, creating proposals, drafting specs, or similar documentation tasks.

skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code, no network calls, and no file system operations beyond standard Claude tools. The skill is a workflow guide that only processes user-provided context and generates text suggestions.

content.value_statement: Writing technical docs, proposals, or specs alone can lead to unclear results that confuse readers. This skill provides a three-stage workflow to gather context, refine content iteratively, and test readability before sharing.
actual_capabilities: Guides users through three-stage documentation workflow
Facilitates context gathering with clarifying questions
Brainstorms and curates document section content
Creates and iterates on document drafts using artifacts or files
Tests document clarity with sub-agent reader simulation
Provides final review and publishing recommendations
limitations: Does not access external documents without user action
Does not perform research or fetch external data
Does not generate images or graphics
Requires user participation at each workflow stage

use_cases.title: Technical Specs and Design Docs
use_cases.description: Create clear technical specifications and architecture decision records that teammates can understand without additional explanation.

use_cases.title: Product Requirements and Proposals
use_cases.description: Structure product requirements documents and business proposals with proper context for stakeholder review.

use_cases.title: Decision Records and RFCs
use_cases.description: Document technical decisions with full context so future team members understand the reasoning behind choices.

prompt_templates.title: Start Documentation
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to write a technical document
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to write a [document type: technical spec, design doc, RFC, proposal]. Can you walk me through your doc co-authoring workflow?

prompt_templates.title: Continue Existing Work
prompt_templates.scenario: User has an existing document to improve
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a [document type] that needs work. Let me share the current content and we can use your workflow to refine it.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Draft
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a quick [document type] using your structured approach. I have the basic ideas ready.

prompt_templates.title: Reader Testing
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to test document clarity
prompt_templates.prompt: My [document type] is drafted. Can we run reader testing to check if it will be clear to people who were not part of creating it?

output_examples.input: Help me write a technical spec for a new API feature
output: I'll guide you through a structured three-stage workflow:
Stage 1: Context Gathering - I'll ask questions about your API, audience, and goals
Stage 2: Refinement & Structure - We'll build the document section by section
Stage 3: Reader Testing - We'll test if the spec is clear to new readers
Would you like to proceed with this workflow, or do you prefer to work freeform?

best_practices: Provide all relevant context upfront, even if it seems disorganized
Answer clarifying questions specifically to improve output quality
Use the reader testing stage to catch assumptions that seem obvious to you
anti_patterns: Skipping context gathering and expecting clear output without background
Providing only minimal answers to clarifying questions
Skipping reader testing and sharing docs before external validation

faq.question: Which document types work best with this skill?
faq.answer: Technical specs, PRDs, design docs, RFCs, decision records, proposals, and any structured documentation that needs to communicate complex ideas clearly.

faq.question: How long does the complete workflow take?
faq.answer: Time varies based on document complexity. Simple docs may take 30 minutes. Complex technical specifications may require multiple sessions.

faq.question: Can I use my existing document template?
faq.answer: Yes. Share your template or link to an existing document. The workflow adapts to follow your preferred structure and format.

faq.question: Is my document data stored anywhere?
faq.answer: Documents are processed in your current session only. No data is sent to external services beyond standard Claude functionality.

faq.question: What if I get stuck during the workflow?
faq.answer: You can skip stages or work freeform at any point. The skill adapts to your preferences and gives you agency to adjust the process.

faq.question: How is this different from regular Claude prompting?
faq.answer: This skill provides a structured framework that prevents common documentation mistakes like unclear assumptions, missing context, and reader confusion.
